data: Temel Eğitimde Erken Okul Terkinin Önlenmesi ve Yabancı Dil Öğretiminin Desteklenmesi
St Johns CofE (C) School, Wetley Rocks

Saimbey Primary School has not participated in an EU project before.We have a potential to do an EU project.We organise a project  team in order to participate  in school staff mobility.If we have chance to do our project, lots of students,tecahers and parents will share our responsibilities.
       Under the Erasmus+ Project process  our staff will  improve and refresh the methods and approachees used in teaching and training in order to better motivate the students to finalize the compulsory education, to be aware about the teaching methods of teaching  foreign languages in primary schools and to see good practice examples in this respect. In the mean time, the experience abroad will help our staff to improve its foreign language skills and competencies and to gain specific terminology related to the project topic.
    Our project will last 24 months. 7 teacher will join the project mobilities. 6 teacher will get the How to motivate students to finalize their compulsory education in Holland.One English teacher will participate in a job shadowing project in order to share her/his experiences with colleagues for a better language teaching atmosphere in our school.
        During the project time we will work with media and local actors to accomplish  impact and dissemination works of the project.We will use social media tools from the beginning to the end in order to share our experiences and gains with the  other colleagues and institutions.The information  and experiences acquired with the project , will be shared in the School Board, the school web site and facebook accounts as dissemination activity. Thus, the teachers, students and parents will be informed besides many people.
     Under the project process, we will  acquire developed basic skills and multilingualism in all fields of education and training, using innovative and student-centred pedagogical approaches and developing appropriate assessment and certification methods, based on learning outcomes.
          Consequently we can say that, with the support of Erasmus + Project we will develop educational capacities and produce graduates; self-confident, qualified, well-educated, entrepreneur  generations in the  happy and welfare European Society.We will be good models to our primary school students about being self-confident and being a part of European Citizenship.
SKILLS FOR THE FUTURE OF EUROPE
St Johns CofE (C) School, Wetley Rocks

Our project aims to increase employment skills  and improve opportunities in our young people at a time of great challenge in Europe. The partnership will focus on sharing, developing and transferring innovative practices in education between the participating schools.
The project will focus on equipping our children with SKILLS FOR THE FUTURE OF EUROPE, to ensure that they are prepared for employment. 
The project will aim to raise aspirations in our children at a time when they are still young enough for this to impact on their future employment potential. Many  children do not achieve as well as they should in subjects such as Maths and Literacy, Science and ICT unless they see WHY these skills are important. We will explain and demonstrate to them the need for working hard at these subjects in primary school, as this will be a good foundation for success at secondary (high) school, and for later careers, either academic or technical. We will also develop other skills needed for employment, including creativity, problem solving, teamwork, perseverance, character and resilience. Older students will act as mentors to younger children in developing workplace skills.
Studies show that you have to interest children in the idea of university or college education early. We aim to impact on attitudes towards all aspects of education and training for employment.
Ours will be a practical project with local business to engage those children who do not attain as well as they could because they do not fully understand the lifelong implications of learning .
The partnerships is composed of five schools serving varied communities and age ranges(from Kindergarten to secondary school) in the UK, Poland, Germany, Turkey, and Italy. Some of the partner schools have prior experiences of successful Comenius projects which focused on areas of learning including music and literacy, and healthy, active lifestyles. Some of the partners are new to Comenius, and will benefit from the experience of the rest of the group in working collaboratively across Europe.
The project will focus on making local links between schools and  businesses which are forward looking and innovative in creating employment and economic success. Through this contact the students will develop skills of entrepreneurship which they will apply in their own choice of enterprise. Throughout the project, the students will share their experiences with each other, their own school community,partner schools and the wider community. Their progress and engagement will be monitored closely to measure the impact on attitudes to learning and understanding of the relevance of key skills to future employment.
